meanings.definition: Of or relating to the Christian gospel or the teachings of the New Testament.
meanings.sent1: The church service had an evangelical message about love and forgiveness.
meanings.sent2: She appreciated the evangelical approach to spreading the teachings of Jesus.
meanings.sent3: The evangelical preacher's enthusiasm was contagious.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as evangelical as her words, spreading joy to all.
meanings.sent5: The evangelical beliefs were deeply ingrained in the community.

meanings.definition: A member of a Protestant Christian denomination that emphasizes the authority of the Bible and personal conversion.
meanings.sent1: He considered himself an evangelical and attended church regularly.
meanings.sent2: The evangelicals gathered for a prayer meeting to discuss their faith.
meanings.sent3: The group of evangelicals organized a charity event to help the community.
meanings.sent4: She was known as the evangelical of the neighborhood, always ready to lend a helping hand.
meanings.sent5: The evangelical shared his beliefs with kindness and sincerity.
